thread.title: Swipe Elite Power with 5.5-inch display, VoLTE and 4,000mAh battery launched for Rs 6,999
thread.title_full: Swipe Elite Power with 5.5-inch display, VoLTE and 4,000mAh battery launched for Rs 6,999

title: Swipe Elite Power with 5.5-inch display, VoLTE and 4,000mAh battery launched for Rs 6,999
text:
Swipe Elite Power with 5.5-inch display, VoLTE and 4,000mAh battery launched for... Swipe Elite Power with 5.5-inch display, VoLTE and 4,000mAh battery launched for Rs 6,999 By - January 30, 2017 “The Elite Power is a budget offering with an all-metal body, fingerprint sensor and 16GB of storage” 
Earlier this month, Swipe launched the Konnect Grand as one of the most affordable 5-inchers with a quad-core SoC in India at Rs 2,799. Now the company has launched a new budget smartphone dubbed the Elite Power. It is a VoLTE (voice over LTE)-enabled offering with a premium all-metal body, a beefy 4,000mAh battery and a fingerprint sensor that’s located on its back panel. 
The Swipe Elite Power features a 5.5-inch HD IPS display, and boots Android 6.0 Marshmallow. The phone utilises a 1.1GHz quad-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 210 processor, mated to Adreno 304 Graphics and 2GB of RAM. The storage capacity on board is 16GB, which can be further increased up to 32GB by inserting a microSD card. 
The camera department includes an 8-megapixel primary shooter with an LED flash and a 5-megapixel selfie snapper. Apart from 4G and VoLTE, the phone’s other connectivity features include hybrid dual-SIM slots, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 4.0 and GPS. The 4,000mAh battery of the device is rated to deliver 48 hours of regular usage and online video streaming for up to eight hours. 
The Swipe Elite Power has been priced competitively at Rs 6,999. The phone will be available on Flipkart soon in a single Space Grey hue. Facebook Comments
